decks.notes: This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Collected Company to generate card advantage and find additional threats. With a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the tempo of the game. Additionally, cards like Spectacular Spider-Man and Silk, Web Weaver provide additional utility and resilience to removal spells.

This deck focuses on assembling Jeskai Ascendancy along with a mix of creatures and spells to generate a powerful combo engine. By untapping creatures and generating mana, the deck aims to draw through its library, generating card advantage and eventually finding a win condition to overwhelm the opponent. Through careful sequencing of spells and utilizing the powerful abilities of Jeskai Ascendancy, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and quickly close out games. The combination of mana dorks, cantrips, and Ascendancy's abilities creates a potent engine capable of overpowering opponents.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, as well as targeted removal like Fatal Push and Bile Blight. It also aims to control the board with creatures like Gifted Aetherborn and Graveyard Trespasser while using powerful Planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to advantage. The deck also includes some big threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Archfiend of the Dross to finish off the opponent. The mana base is designed to support a solid mana curve and provide utility with cards like Field of Ruin and Castle Locthwain.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cheap, evasive spirits to quickly pressure opponents and disrupt their game plan with counter spells and removal. The key strategy is to maintain a board presence while controlling the opponent's plays, leveraging the synergy between spirit tribal cards like Supreme Phantom and Mausoleum Wanderer. By consistently applying pressure and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm opponents in the Pioneer format.

The deck focuses on utilizing green devotion to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells. It aims to establish a strong board presence early on with mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, as well as Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to generate massive amounts of mana. It includes high-impact cards like Vorinclex, Elesh Norn, and Old-Growth Troll to apply pressure and close out the game swiftly. Storm the Festival and Cavalier of Thorns provide card advantage and creature consistency, while Leyline of the Guildpact helps to protect against removal spells.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to aggressively disrupt your opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while utilizing evasive threats like Moon-Circuit Hacker and Faerie Miscreant to quickly close out the game. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Cecil, Dark Knight provide additional pressure and versatile options for dealing with opposing threats. The deck also benefits from a mix of disruption, removal, and card advantage to maintain tempo and secure victory in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to draw cards and gain card advantage in order to control the game. With a wide range of multicolor cards and versatile spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while setting up powerful plays. The inclusion of a companion in Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional flexibility and options for the player. Overall, the deck seeks to establish board control, generate card advantage, and eventually close out the game with powerful threats and spells.

This UW Control deck focuses on card advantage, counterspells, and removal to control the game and outvalue opponents. The deck includes cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Dovin's Veto to control the board and protect its own resources. It also includes powerful finishers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Settle the Wreckage to close out games once it has gained control. The deck aims to outlast opponents and grind them out with its efficient answers and powerful threats.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to create a fast and aggressive early game presence by utilizing low-cost creatures like Elvish Mystic and Aven Interrupter. This deck also aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards such as Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The inclusion of Collected Company allows for additional creature plays and the ability to quickly build a strong board presence. Overall, this deck emphasizes speed, efficiency, and disruption to overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

This Boros Aggro deck is focused on equipping creatures with powerful equipment like Colossus Hammer and Shadowspear to quickly overwhelm opponents. With cards like Sigarda's Aid and Portable Hole to speed up the process, the deck aims to deal damage efficiently and aggressively. Creatures like Kellan, the Fae-Blooded and Cloud, Midgar Mercenary provide additional threats, while lands like Sacred Foundry and Needleverge Pathway ensure consistent mana production. Overall, this deck is designed to attack early and often, putting pressure on opponents to respond quickly or be overrun.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix, utilizing cards like Treasure Cruise and Consider to maintain card advantage. Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse provide removal while Picklock Prankster generates value by stealing opponent's cards. The deck aims to control the board with efficient spells and creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter, while also having the potential to deal burst damage with the reoccurring Arclight Phoenix. The inclusion of Proft's Eidetic Memory and Spikefield Hazard provides additional versatility and options for disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and burning spells to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature beats and direct burn spells while also utilizing cards like Questing Druid and Monstrous Rage to pump up its creatures for extra damage. With a mix of powerful creatures and efficient burn spells, this deck aims to apply pressure early and keep the opponent on the back foot throughout the game.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to maintain board control through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Utilizing cards like Dovin's Veto, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources. The inclusion of cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Consult the Star Charts further enhances card advantage and selection. The deck also includes options for removal and board wipes, such as Settle the Wreckage and March of Otherworldly Light, to deal with threats efficiently.

The main theme of this Boros Aggro deck is to have a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing low-cost creatures like Ornithopter, Novice Inspector, and Warden of the Inner Sky to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. Cards like Shrapnel Blast and Gleeful Demolition provide additional reach and removal options, while Venerated Loxodon and Cosmogrand Zenith offer powerful buff effects to enhance your creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and direct damage spells to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively play creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, efficient creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board and keep pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, consistent damage output and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad to generate value through blinking creatures and enchantments. It includes a mix of disruptive spells like Get Lost and Essence Flux, along with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Mistmoors and Aang. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and tempo plays, while also having the flexibility to handle various threats with cards like Spell Queller and Teferi's Time Twist. The land base provides access to the necessary colors for the deck's spells and creatures.
